resources.string: Here are some useful websites to keep you up to date about covid-19
ministry of health and\n family welfare
Q3-Who is at risk of developing severe illness?
Q5-Can the virus that causes COVID-19 be transmitted through the air?

Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans. In humans, several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). The most recently discovered coronavirus causes coronavirus disease COVID-19.
COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus. This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

While we are still learning about how COVID-2019 affects people, older persons and persons with pre-existing medical conditions (such as high blood pressure, heart disease, lung disease, cancer or diabetes) appear to develop serious illness more often than others.

People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs or exhales. These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person. Other people then catch COVID-19 by touching these objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth. People can also catch COVID-19 if they breathe in droplets from a person with COVID-19 who coughs out or exhales droplets. This is why it is important to stay more than 1 meter (3 feet) away from a person who is sick.

Studies to date suggest that the virus that causes COVID-19 is mainly transmitted through contact with respiratory droplets rather than through the air. See previous answer on “How does COVID-19 spread?”

A runny nose is excess nasal drainage. It may be a thin clear fluid, thick mucus or something in between. But runny nose is not the only/exactly a symptom of COVID-19
Headache is the symptom of pain in the face, head, or neck. It can occur as a migraine, tension-type headache, or cluster headache.

A cough, also known as tussis, is a voluntary or involuntary act that clears the throat and breathing passage of foreign particles,microbes,fluids,and mucus; it is a rapid expulsion of air from the lungs. Coughing can be done deliberately or as part of a reflex.

Pain or irritation in the throat that can occur with or without swallowing, often accompanies infections, such as a cold or flu.Examples include overuse of voice,very dry mouth or sleeping with the mouth open.

A fever is a body temperature that is higher than normal. A normal temperature is usually around 98.6 F. if body temperature of any person is more then 100.4°F/38°C or higher then the person cough, or trouble breathing
Breathing difficulty describes discomfort when breathing and feeling as if you can\'t draw a complete breath. This can develop gradually or come on suddenly.
Hand washing, also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one\'s hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
Avoid touching the face again and again because it is one of the reason for fast trasmission of COVID-19 virus to trasmit into lungs.
in hospitals, doctors are avoiding shaking hands so that to stop the transmission of germs/viruses from sick people, so avoid shaking hands, hugs and talk making one meter distance to sick people.

Preparing for coronavirus (COVID-19) means having what you need to stay home. Officials are asking people to only go out when absolutely needed so they don\'t get sick. Keeping your household supplied will prevent you from running out of essentials.
The idea is to cover your mouth when you cough (or sneeze) so the germs in your body are not propelled into the air or across the room, which could make others sick.

With the help of cleanliness, we can keep our physical and mental health clean, which will make us feel good. Maintaining cleanliness is the essential part of healthy living because it is the cleanliness only which helps to improve our personality by keeping clean externally and internally.

There is a lot of false information around. These are the facts.

People of all ages CAN be infected by the coronavirus. Older people, and people with pre-existing medical conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease) appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill with the virus.
Antibiotics DO NOT work against viruses, antibiotics only work against bacteria.
To date, there is NO specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat the coronavirus.
Garlic is healthy but there is NO evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the coronavirus.
There is NO evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline has protected people from infection with the coronavirus.
Vaccines against pneumonia, such as pneumococcal vaccine and Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine, DO NOT provide protection against the coronavirus.
Spraying alcohol or chlorine all over your body WILL NOT kill viruses that have already entered your body
Thermal scanners CAN detect if people have a fever but CANNOT detect whether or not someone has the coronavirus
Taking a hot bath DOES NOT prevent the coronavirus
There is NO evidence that companion animals/pets such as dogs or cats can transmit the coronavirus.
The coronavirus CANNOT be transmitted through mosquito bites.
The coronavirus CAN be transmitted in areas with hot and humid climates
Cold weather and snow CANNOT kill the coronavirus.
For more information visit\n WHO-Myth buster
I hereby,confirm that to the best of my knowledge all information given by me is true.

The applicant will have go to Odisha government\'s webiste - covid19.odisha.gov.in - for applying e-passes. On the portal, applicant needs to provide details of travel itinerary, passenger and driver information.
After the submission of details, the application will be reviewed by the district authorities. On approval, ePass can be viewed, downloaded and printed from the website. Also, applicant receives ePass number with vehicle and passenger details through SMS and email.

•Visit the website of the respective state/union territory.


•Select the 'apply e-pass' tab and fill the e-pass form with details asked for. You will be required to provide details on: Name, Mobile Number, Government ID, Vehicle registration number (RC book), District and town name


•Upload the supporting documents, if any, and submit your application.


•On approval, you will receive the message from the authority.


•You could take a print-out of the e-pass or show the e-copy to the police and other authorities enquiring about your movement.n\n
For Covid-19 ePasses in Odisha log on to https://covid19.odisha.gov.in/
For Covid-19 ePasses for migrant workers \nhttps://covid19regd.odisha.gov.in/migrant-registration.aspx
